title: Opinion | Mitch McConnell’s Motive: Self-Interest
summary:
To the Editor:Re “Senate Leader Seeks to Avoid Vote Challenge” (front page, Dec. 16):For the sake of this nation and its great experiment in democracy, I am elated by Tuesday’s acknowledgment by Mitch McConnell, the Senate majority leader, of Joe Biden’s legitimate win and his status as our president-elect.
Yet Americans must not be fooled by what just happened.
The senator from Kentucky acted in complete and utter self-interest.
Do not misunderstand where Mitch McConnell’s loyalty ultimately lies.
It is to power itself and his own and his party’s hold on it.
paragraphs: Re “Senate Leader Seeks to Avoid Vote Challenge” (front page, Dec. 16):

For the sake of this nation and its great experiment in democracy, I am elated by Tuesday’s acknowledgment by Mitch McConnell, the Senate majority leader, of Joe Biden’s legitimate win and his status as our president-elect.
Yet Americans must not be fooled by what just happened. The senator from Kentucky acted in complete and utter self-interest.

Had Donald Trump succeeded in delegitimizing the presidential election or in simply maintaining his sham with active or tacit congressional support, our entire democracy and its foundational system of elections by the people would be forever called into question, including the status going forward of every newly elected or re-elected senator and representative.
Do not misunderstand where Mitch McConnell’s loyalty ultimately lies. It is to power itself and his own and his party’s hold on it.
